titleInfo.title: Huey P. Long addressing the audience on game day of the Vanderbilt Commodores vs. LSU Tigers football game, 1934 October 27

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: A snapshot of Louisiana politician Huey P. Long addressing the football stadium audience at the Vanderbilt - Louisiana State University game in Nashville on 27 October 1934. This football game with the Vanderbilt Commodores occurred soon after the LSU team started on its winning streak. There was a huge contingent of student supporters of the LSU Tigers in the stadium on game day with about 5,000 LSU rooters and a band of over two hundred who had traveled to Nashville via six special trains of fourteen cars each. At half time, Long addressed the spectators thanking attendees for a friendly reception and hoping that they were enjoying the game. LSU beat Vanderbilt, 29 to 0. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 snapshot photograph : b & w ; 3 x 4.25 in.
